reviewText: I have to admit this is better than it looks. It plays kind of like a casual MMO, with the majority of the gameplay involving simple quests for the townsfolk. If you're in the mood to pick berries and make clothes for yourself and others, you could do far worse than this game.\n\nThe characters and storylines are simple, but effective, and - much to my surprise - they can actually be pretty funny. The game uses a lot of internet humor, but I don't mean copy+pasted memes. One of the main characters repeatedly disturbs others with his sexual deviance (dressing up as a furry is only the beginning), and another gets addicted to an MMO. I found these things to be an amusing surprise when I was just looking for a simple game to fill a few hours with easy mindless clicking.

reviewText:
I got this game in a bundle a while back, and it's surprisingly addictive and very fun.

You crash land your hot air balloon on an island, and your goal is to repair your balloon and go home. In order to do this, you must perform tasks for the natives, which usually involve crafting or cooking various items for them, or delivering items to someone else. Rather than climbing trees or digging for things yourself, you use one of the many animals roaming the island to do it for you. As the animals level up, they can climb higher trees, dig tougher rock piles, and fight stronger...other animals, for the items they drop. Sometimes, they will drop an egg, which you can hatch into a new friend. Collect them all!
voteText: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Perfect game to accompany a binge watch of a fairly complex TV show.
That is: it's easy. It's cute. There is mild humor, and mostly you will direct whatever pet you have active to dig, climb, or make friends with other pets. You'll farm, kinda. You'll walk all over the place but the mini-map allows you to click on your destination and go fix yourself a snack while your character self navigates. If you happen to get engrossed in your show, your character will sit on the map, amusing itself contentedly.

I tend to play more intense games on consoles; my computer is for keeping my fingers busy while Im watching TV. This game was absolutely perfect.

I'm gonna put it this way: have you ever downloaded one of those cute little freemium apps for your phone

reviewText: Willow of Wandercraft Lite. Wander through the willows and discover the mysteries that will help you with your ultimate quest; going home. The only raiding you'll need to do is yout fridge because if you don't, you'll feel the hunger within as you pull an all-nighter trying to accomplish everything this wonderful game has to offer.
